Amputation.procedure:
CORE PROTOCOL: TRAUMATIC AMPUTATION

PRIORITY: Massive hemorrhage control before all other care.
TOURNIQUET: Apply high-and-tight proximal tourniquet using ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY. If active bleeding continues after 2 minutes, apply a second tourniquet above the first.
JUNCTIONAL BLEEDING: IF bleeding is at groin/axilla/neck where tourniquet is ineffective, THEN pack with hemostatic gauze and hold uninterrupted pressure for 10 minutes.
STUMP CARE: Cover exposed tissue with sterile moist gauze, then apply a loose outer dressing. Keep the patient warm.
PART PRESERVATION: Wrap amputated part in moist sterile gauze, seal in a waterproof bag, then place that bag on cold packs/ice slurry. Never place tissue directly on ice or in water.
SHOCK MONITORING: Reassess pulse, mental status, skin perfusion, and bleeding every 5 minutes until stable, then every 15 minutes.
EVACUATION BIAS: Treat traumatic amputation as URGENT by default; escalate to IMMEDIATE for uncontrolled bleeding, altered mental status, or worsening perfusion.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT delay hemorrhage control for cleaning, closure, or noncritical documentation.

anatomy_guardrails.Ear/Nose/Lip:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: EAR/NOSE/LIP AMPUTATION

AIRWAY FIRST: Continuously assess airway patency; suction blood/secretions as needed from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
HEMOSTASIS: Use direct pressure with sterile gauze; avoid circumferential compression around the neck.
TISSUE PRESERVATION: Preserve avulsed tissue per cold-chain protocol; label side and injury time.
EYE SAFETY: IF injury is near orbit, THEN protect globe and avoid direct ocular pressure.
INFECTION CONTROL: Irrigate gross contamination gently with saline/potable water, then re-cover with sterile dressing.
REASSESS: Airway, bleeding, and mental status every 5 minutes until stable.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT use airtight occlusive facial dressings that trap blood/secretions near airway structures.
anatomy_guardrails.Finger/Thumb:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: FINGER/THUMB AMPUTATION

FUNCTION PRIORITY: Thumb injuries carry highest functional risk; document thumb involvement immediately.
HEMOSTASIS: Start with direct pressure. IF uncontrolled, THEN apply proximal limb tourniquet (forearm/upper arm) per ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
STUMP PROTECTION: Cover with sterile moist gauze and loose wrap; keep hand elevated when possible.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated digit using sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
IMMOBILIZATION: Splint hand/wrist in functional position to reduce further tissue trauma.
REASSESS: Distal perfusion, pain, and bleeding every 10 minutes until stable, then every 30 minutes.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT clamp or tie visible vessels in the field unless explicitly required for life-threatening hemorrhage.
anatomy_guardrails.Foot/Ankle:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: FOOT/ANKLE AMPUTATION

HEMOSTASIS: Control bleeding with direct pressure first; escalate to proximal tourniquet if active flow persists.
TOURNIQUET POSITION: Place above the injury zone; tighten until bleeding stops and document time.
STUMP CARE: Apply sterile moist dressing and padded outer wrap from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
IMMOBILIZATION: Splint lower limb to reduce motion-related rebleeding.
NO WEIGHT-BEARING: Keep patient non-ambulatory.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated tissue with sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
REASSESS: Bleeding, perfusion, and pain every 10 minutes.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT allow ambulation "to test stability" after hemorrhage control.
anatomy_guardrails.Forearm:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: FOREARM AMPUTATION

HEMORRHAGE PRIORITY: Forearm arterial bleeding can be rapid; escalate early to proximal tourniquet if direct pressure fails.
TOURNIQUET POSITION: Use upper-arm placement, not over the injury zone.
STUMP COVER: Sterile moist dressing plus loose compression wrap.
IMMOBILIZATION: Splint elbow-to-wrist to limit motion and rebleeding.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated segment with sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
NEUROVASCULAR CHECK: Document baseline motor/sensory status of remaining limb segments.
REASSESS: Bleeding and perfusion every 5-10 minutes until stable.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT repeatedly remove dressings to inspect unless bleeding status worsens.
anatomy_guardrails.Genitals:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: GENITAL AMPUTATION

HEMOSTASIS: Use gentle but firm direct pressure with sterile gauze from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
PRIVACY + SAFETY: Maintain dignity while preserving full visual access to active bleeding points.
URINARY RISK: IF blood at urethral meatus or inability to void, THEN treat as high-risk and prioritize evacuation.
TISSUE PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated tissue with sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
PAIN/SHOCK CONTROL: Reassess mental status, pulse, and bleeding every 5 minutes until stable.
INFECTION PREVENTION: Cover with clean sterile dressing and keep area protected from contamination.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT insert catheters or probe wounds in the field unless airway/life-saving indication exists.
anatomy_guardrails.Hand/Wrist:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: HAND/WRIST AMPUTATION

HEMOSTASIS: Begin direct pressure; escalate quickly to proximal tourniquet for persistent active flow.
TOURNIQUET POSITION: Place proximal on forearm/upper arm as needed; document application time.
STUMP MANAGEMENT: Sterile moist dressing + loose outer wrap from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
IMMOBILIZATION: Splint wrist/forearm to minimize rebleeding and pain.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated tissue with sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
FUNCTION NOTE: Document dominant hand and thumb involvement for handover.
REASSESS: Bleeding, pain, and perfusion every 10 minutes.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT use tight circumferential hand wraps that compromise residual perfusion.
anatomy_guardrails.LowerLeg:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: LOWERLEG AMPUTATION

HEMORRHAGE RISK: Treat as high-volume blood loss until proven otherwise.
TOURNIQUET: Apply proximal tourniquet (thigh level if needed) when direct pressure is inadequate.
STUMP CARE: Use sterile moist dressing and loose pressure wrap from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
IMMOBILIZATION: Splint knee/ankle axis to reduce movement and rebleeding.
SHOCK SURVEILLANCE: Monitor mental status, radial pulse quality, skin temperature, and capillary refill every 5 minutes.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated segment via sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
EVACUATION: Default URGENT; escalate IMMEDIATE for persistent bleeding or perfusion decline.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT lower vigilance after initial bleeding control; delayed rebleed is common.
anatomy_guardrails.Thigh:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: THIGH AMPUTATION

CRITICAL HEMORRHAGE: Assume life-threatening blood loss immediately.
DUAL TOURNIQUET READINESS: IF bleeding persists after first tourniquet, THEN place second tourniquet above first without delay.
JUNCTIONAL AWARENESS: For very proximal injuries, add hemostatic packing/manual pressure where tourniquet effect is incomplete.
STUMP COVER: Sterile moist dressing, loose outer wrap, and strict heat conservation.
SHOCK CONTROL: Supine positioning (unless airway compromise), continuous reassessment every 5 minutes.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated segment using sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
EVACUATION STATE: IMMEDIATE unless clearly stable and bleeding fully controlled.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT loosen tourniquet to "check bleeding" during transport.
anatomy_guardrails.Toe:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: TOE AMPUTATION

HEMOSTASIS: Start with direct pressure and elevated foot position.
ESCALATION: IF active bleeding continues, THEN apply controlled proximal compression/tourniquet per ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
WOUND PROTECTION: Cover stump with sterile moist gauze and light outer dressing.
PART PRESERVATION: Preserve amputated toe with sealed-bag cold-chain protocol.
INFECTION PREVENTION: Keep wound clean/dry externally; replace soiled dressings promptly.
OFFLOADING: No weight-bearing on injured foot until stable.
REASSESS: Bleeding and distal perfusion every 15 minutes initially.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT close or seal the wound with occlusive film in contaminated marine settings.
anatomy_guardrails.UpperArm:
REGIONAL PROTOCOL: UPPERARM AMPUTATION

HEMORRHAGE PRIORITY: Treat as major arterial bleed risk.
TOURNIQUET: Apply as proximal as possible; if active flow persists, place second tourniquet above first.
AXILLA/CHEST CHECK: Assess adjacent axillary/chest bleeding and control with packing/pressure if present.
STUMP CARE: Cover with sterile moist gauze and loose outer dressing from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
IMMOBILIZATION: Stabilize shoulder/upper limb to reduce rebleeding.
SHOCK MONITORING: Reassess pulse, mental status, skin signs, and bleeding every 5 minutes.
EVACUATION BIAS: URGENT minimum; IMMEDIATE if unstable or bleeding not fully controlled.
Negative Constraint: DO NOT delay evacuation for prolonged local wound manipulation.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Stable controlled bleeding:
ACUITY PROTOCOL: STABLE CONTROLLED BLEEDING

1. ACUITY FOCUS: In Amputation, treat "Stable controlled bleeding" as a high-priority state.
2. IMMEDIATE ACTION: stabilize primary threat, protect function, and continue protocol care.
3. MONITORING: Reassess key findings every 15 minutes until trend is stable.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate to URGENT/IMMEDIATE if trend worsens despite intervention.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY only and cross-check patient history/allergies before medication decisions.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT continue lower-priority procedures while this acuity state is uncontrolled.
severity_modifiers.Significant bleeding:
ACUITY PROTOCOL: SIGNIFICANT BLEEDING

1. ACUITY FOCUS: In Amputation, treat "Significant bleeding" as a high-priority state.
2. IMMEDIATE ACTION: prioritize bleeding control and secure dressing/tourniquet support using ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY.
3. MONITORING: Reassess key findings every 10 minutes until trend is stable.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate rapidly if active flow persists or perfusion declines.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY only and cross-check patient history/allergies before medication decisions.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT perform procedural extras until bleeding is clearly controlled.
severity_modifiers.Uncontrolled bleeding / shock signs:
ACUITY PROTOCOL: UNCONTROLLED BLEEDING / SHOCK SIGNS

1. ACUITY FOCUS: In Amputation, treat "Uncontrolled bleeding / shock signs" as a high-priority state.
2. IMMEDIATE ACTION: treat as active life threat: hemorrhage control first, then airway/breathing/circulation reassessment.
3. MONITORING: Reassess key findings every 5 minutes until trend is stable.
4. ESCALATION RULE: If bleeding/perfusion does not improve after one full control cycle, set evacuation state to IMMEDIATE.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY only and cross-check patient history/allergies before medication decisions.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT delay hemorrhage control for irrigation, closure, or cosmetic steps.
severity_modifiers.Altered mental status:
ACUITY PROTOCOL: ALTERED MENTAL STATUS

1. ACUITY FOCUS: In Amputation, treat "Altered mental status" as a high-priority state.
2. IMMEDIATE ACTION: treat as neurologic warning state: secure safety, reassess airway/oxygenation/perfusion, and reduce stimulation.
3. MONITORING: Reassess key findings every 5 minutes until trend is stable.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate when confusion/drowsiness worsens or new focal deficits appear.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY only and cross-check patient history/allergies before medication decisions.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT dismiss altered mentation as anxiety in acute trauma.
severity_modifiers.Deteriorating perfusion:
ACUITY PROTOCOL: DETERIORATING PERFUSION

1. ACUITY FOCUS: In Amputation, treat "Deteriorating perfusion" as a high-priority state.
2. IMMEDIATE ACTION: treat as progression warning: repeat focused exam and verify prior interventions remain effective.
3. MONITORING: Reassess key findings every 10 minutes until trend is stable.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate if deterioration continues across two reassessment cycles.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY only and cross-check patient history/allergies before medication decisions.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT rely on one-time improvement; trend over time is decisive.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Sharp cut:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: SHARP CUT

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume deeper tissue injury than surface appearance suggests.
2. INITIAL ACTION: stabilize region, control bleeding, and preserve function while minimizing additional movement.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess pain, perfusion, neurologic status, and bleeding trend every 10-15 minutes early.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate evacuation when serial checks show progression or nonresponse to initial care.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.Crush/compression:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: CRUSH/COMPRESSION

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume deeper tissue injury than surface appearance suggests.
2. INITIAL ACTION: stabilize region, control bleeding, and preserve function while minimizing additional movement.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess pain, perfusion, neurologic status, and bleeding trend every 10-15 minutes early.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate evacuation when serial checks show progression or nonresponse to initial care.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.High-energy/snapback:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: HIGH-ENERGY/SNAPBACK

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume occult structural and internal injury risk despite limited external findings.
2. INITIAL ACTION: prioritize life-threat screen, strict immobilization where indicated, and early trend monitoring.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess vitals/perfusion/neurologic trend every 5-10 minutes initially.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Use lower threshold for URGENT/IMMEDIATE evacuation due to delayed decompensation risk.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.Machinery entanglement:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: MACHINERY ENTANGLEMENT

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume ligament/tendon/nerve stress beyond what initial exam shows.
2. INITIAL ACTION: immobilize in position of best perfusion and avoid forceful manipulation.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess pain, swelling, and distal neurovascular status every 10-15 minutes.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate when function deteriorates or pain/swelling accelerates.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.Marine bite/sting:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: MARINE BITE/STING

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume deeper tissue injury than surface appearance suggests.
2. INITIAL ACTION: stabilize region, control bleeding, and preserve function while minimizing additional movement.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess pain, perfusion, neurologic status, and bleeding trend every 10-15 minutes early.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Escalate evacuation when serial checks show progression or nonresponse to initial care.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.Blast/explosive force:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: BLAST/EXPLOSIVE FORCE

1. HIDDEN-INJURY BIAS: For Amputation, assume occult structural and internal injury risk despite limited external findings.
2. INITIAL ACTION: prioritize life-threat screen, strict immobilization where indicated, and early trend monitoring.
3. MONITORING WINDOW: reassess vitals/perfusion/neurologic trend every 5-10 minutes initially.
4. ESCALATION RULE: Use lower threshold for URGENT/IMMEDIATE evacuation due to delayed decompensation risk.
5. RESOURCE RULE: Use only ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY tools/supplies and document mechanism-linked risks explicitly.

Negative Constraint: DO NOT anchor on external appearance when mechanism implies deeper injury.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Other / Unspecified.procedure: PROBLEM UNSPECIFIED (TRAUMA): Control hemorrhage, confirm airway/breathing/circulation stability, protect from contamination, immobilize when indicated, and defer definitive repair until hidden injury risk is screened. Reassess every 10 minutes.

anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

critical_alerts.Tension_Pneumothorax: IF patient has respiratory distress AND (tracheal deviation OR distended neck veins OR absent breath sounds on one side), THEN perform Needle Decompression immediately. Trigger IMMEDIATE EVACUATION.
critical_alerts.Anaphylaxis: IF sudden rash/hives AND (wheezing OR tongue swelling OR low BP), THEN administer first-line anaphylaxis medication from ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY immediately using labeled route and dose. Repeat per onboard label/protocol if no improvement after 5-15 minutes. Trigger IMMEDIATE EVACUATION.

Illness.mindset: Vitals trends and treatment response only. Avoid rare/complex diagnoses.

Abdominal Pain.procedure: Trend pain pattern, hydration, perfusion, and abdominal red flags in timed cycles. IF rebound/rigidity or shock trend appears, THEN escalate as high-risk abdomen and upgrade evacuation urgency immediately.

anatomy_guardrails.Gastrointestinal: Keep oral intake conservative, avoid repeated deep palpation, and document pain migration each reassessment. IF guarding, rebound, or perfusion decline appears, THEN stop routine care and escalate.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Mild: Use conservative symptom control with strict reassessment intervals. IF pain remains non-progressive and perfusion stays stable, THEN continue onboard monitoring.
severity_modifiers.Persistent: Increase reassessment frequency and track hydration response objectively. IF pain fails to improve after treatment cycles, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.Shock signs: Treat as perfusion emergency now; prioritize circulation support and rapid escalation. IF hypotension, tachycardia, or cold clammy trend persists, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Worsening: Assume evolving internal pathology until proven otherwise. IF symptom intensity rises across reassessments, THEN shorten intervals and escalate disposition.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Fever: Treat as infectious-inflammation risk and trend temperature with perfusion markers. IF fever plus decline persists, THEN escalate to sepsis-risk workflow.
mechanism_modifiers.Rebound/rigidity reported: Treat as peritoneal irritation warning and minimize repeated manipulation. IF findings are reproducible or worsening, THEN escalate evacuation urgency immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Unable to hydrate: Prioritize dehydration prevention and perfusion monitoring now. IF oral rehydration fails, THEN escalate care level and evacuation planning.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Allergic Reaction.procedure: Prioritize airway, breathing, and circulation over rash appearance. IF respiratory involvement or perfusion instability appears, THEN execute anaphylaxis protocol immediately and escalate.

anatomy_guardrails.Systemic: Monitor airway, breathing effort, skin progression, and mentation in short intervals. IF symptoms generalize or recur after initial improvement, THEN escalate monitoring and evacuation urgency.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Anaphylaxis: Treat as immediate life-threat with airway-first actions and continuous observation. IF response is incomplete after first-line treatment, THEN escalate without delay.
severity_modifiers.Breathing involvement: Treat as high-risk airway pathway now with frequent respiratory reassessment. IF work of breathing increases, THEN escalate to emergency disposition.
severity_modifiers.Generalized hives: Treat as systemic progression risk and monitor for airway transition. IF hives spread or systemic signs appear, THEN escalate treatment tier.
severity_modifiers.Localized: Apply local symptom control with scheduled reassessment checks. IF symptoms extend beyond local region, THEN reclassify and escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Known allergen: Remove ongoing exposure source immediately and document trigger confidence. IF repeat exposure is possible onboard, THEN implement strict avoidance controls.
mechanism_modifiers.Prior anaphylaxis history: Assume low threshold for severe progression and monitor continuously. IF any airway or perfusion change appears, THEN escalate as anaphylaxis regardless of initial mild signs.
mechanism_modifiers.Unknown trigger: Treat as unpredictable risk and broaden exposure review while stabilizing patient. IF recurrent symptoms occur, THEN escalate observation duration and evacuation planning.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Breathing Difficulty.procedure: Position to reduce work of breathing, monitor oxygenation trend, and limit exertion. IF respiratory effort worsens or mentation declines, THEN escalate airway/ventilation support and evacuation urgency.

anatomy_guardrails.Respiratory: Track rate, effort, speaking ability, and fatigue in short fixed intervals. IF silent chest, exhaustion, or altered consciousness appears, THEN treat as critical deterioration.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Altered consciousness: Treat as critical oxygenation/ventilation failure risk now. IF consciousness continues to decline, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Breathing distress: Use high-frequency reassessment and early escalation thresholds. IF distress does not improve promptly, THEN escalate intervention tier without delay.
severity_modifiers.Mild: Start conservative support and observe objective respiratory trend. IF mild symptoms persist or progress, THEN reclassify and escalate.
severity_modifiers.Worsening: Treat progression as decompensation risk, not comfort issue. IF objective work of breathing increases across checks, THEN escalate disposition urgently.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Allergen exposure: Treat as airway-reactivity risk and monitor for rapid progression. IF wheeze/stridor or swelling appears, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Asthma history (if known): Assume recurrence potential and use response-to-treatment trend to guide escalation. IF poor response to initial therapy, THEN escalate urgency early.
mechanism_modifiers.Near drowning history: Treat as delayed pulmonary deterioration risk for prolonged monitoring window. IF cough, crackles, or hypoxia worsens, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Smoke/inhalation: Treat as airway injury risk even if early exam looks stable. IF hoarseness, soot signs, or worsening distress appears, THEN escalate airway pathway urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Chest Pain.procedure: Stop exertion, maintain calm positioning, and trend perfusion/respiratory status in timed intervals. IF pain persists with instability markers, THEN escalate as high-acuity cardiopulmonary risk.

anatomy_guardrails.Circulatory: Monitor pulse quality, blood pressure trend, skin signs, and mental status continuously. IF perfusion worsens or rhythm symptoms appear, THEN escalate disposition immediately.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Mild: Begin conservative monitoring and remove exertional stressors. IF symptoms recur or intensify, THEN escalate to urgent pathway.
severity_modifiers.Persistent: Treat as unresolved risk state with tighter reassessment cadence. IF persistence continues despite initial measures, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.Shock signs: Treat as immediate perfusion emergency and prioritize circulation stabilization. IF shock trend continues, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Worsening: Assume active deterioration until trend proves otherwise. IF pain and perfusion trajectory both worsen, THEN escalate without delay.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Exertion: Treat as demand-triggered cardiopulmonary stress and enforce strict rest. IF pain persists at rest, THEN escalate urgency immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Heat stress: Actively cool and rehydrate while tracking perfusion response. IF chest pain continues after cooling/hydration measures, THEN escalate care level.
mechanism_modifiers.Known cardiac history (if known): Lower threshold for aggressive monitoring and evacuation planning. IF instability markers appear, THEN escalate to highest urgency tier early.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Fever / Suspected Infection.procedure: Trend temperature, heart rate, hydration, and mental status at fixed intervals. IF fever with systemic decline persists, THEN escalate under infection/sepsis-risk protocol promptly.

anatomy_guardrails.Systemic: Track whole-body trend markers including mentation, perfusion, and urine output. IF systemic deterioration appears despite treatment, THEN escalate disposition urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Mild: Use supportive care and scheduled trend checks without delay. IF objective trend remains stable, THEN continue onboard protocol.
severity_modifiers.Persistent: Increase reassessment frequency and verify treatment response objectively. IF fever persists across cycles, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.Systemic deterioration: Treat as high-risk systemic progression with aggressive monitoring cadence. IF perfusion or mentation declines, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Worsening: Assume rising complication risk and shorten reassessment intervals immediately. IF trend worsens after interventions, THEN escalate disposition.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Dehydration: Prioritize volume restoration and perfusion checks in each cycle. IF dehydration persists with fever, THEN escalate risk classification.
mechanism_modifiers.Immunocompromised (if known): Treat as reduced reserve state with lower threshold for escalation. IF trend is not clearly improving, THEN escalate early.
mechanism_modifiers.Recent dental issue: Treat as potential infection source and monitor for spread indicators. IF facial/neck swelling or systemic decline appears, THEN escalate urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Recent wound/skin infection: Treat as potential soft-tissue progression with serial boundary and systemic checks. IF redness spread plus fever/tachycardia appears, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Neurologic Symptoms.procedure: Establish baseline neurologic status and repeat focused neuro checks on a strict schedule. IF deficits progress or consciousness declines, THEN escalate to critical neurologic pathway immediately.

anatomy_guardrails.Neurologic: Trend orientation, focal deficits, gait/coordination signals, and seizure activity. IF new focal findings emerge, THEN escalate urgency and evacuation planning.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Altered mental status: Treat as high-acuity neurologic/metabolic emergency until stabilized. IF mentation worsens across checks, THEN escalate to IMMEDIATE pathway.
severity_modifiers.Mild: Use conservative monitoring with documented serial neurologic exams. IF symptoms persist or spread, THEN reclassify and escalate.
severity_modifiers.Seizure: Prioritize airway protection, injury prevention, and post-event neuro reassessment. IF recurrent or prolonged seizure activity occurs, THEN escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Worsening: Treat progression as active neurologic deterioration risk. IF trend does not stabilize rapidly, THEN upgrade evacuation urgency.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.CO/toxic exposure: Remove exposure source immediately and monitor for ongoing neuro decline. IF symptoms persist after removal, THEN escalate urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Heat exposure: Treat as thermal neurostress risk with active cooling and perfusion monitoring. IF neurologic signs persist despite cooling, THEN escalate.
mechanism_modifiers.Recent head impact: Assume post-traumatic neurologic risk and increase observation intensity. IF headache, vomiting, confusion, or deficit worsens, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Vomiting / Diarrhea.procedure: Prioritize rehydration, electrolyte preservation, and perfusion trend checks at fixed intervals. IF fluid losses continue or perfusion declines, THEN escalate urgency and disposition.

anatomy_guardrails.Gastrointestinal: Track intake/output, abdominal symptoms, and dehydration signs each reassessment cycle. IF output remains high or blood appears, THEN escalate care tier immediately.

severity_modifiers.Persistent: Increase reassessment frequency and quantify ongoing fluid losses. IF persistence continues despite treatment, THEN escalate urgency tier.

mechanism_modifiers.Suspected foodborne: Use contamination-control and hydration-first strategy with serial trend checks. IF systemic signs worsen, THEN escalate disposition promptly.
mechanism_modifiers.Unable to keep fluids down: Treat as failed oral hydration pathway and rising perfusion risk. IF inability persists, THEN escalate to urgent evacuation planning.

Chemical Exposure (Skin/Eye/Ingestion).procedure: Stop exposure source first, begin decontamination immediately, and track airway/breathing/perfusion in short intervals. IF symptoms worsen or airway/swallowing becomes compromised, THEN escalate to emergency pathway without delay.

anatomy_guardrails.Eye Exposure: Start immediate continuous irrigation and protect unaffected eye from secondary contamination. IF pain, vision change, or photophobia worsens during reassessment, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Skin / Mucosal Contact: Remove contaminated clothing and irrigate affected area thoroughly before topical decisions. IF burn progression or systemic symptoms appear, THEN escalate care tier immediately.
anatomy_guardrails.Suspected Ingestion Pathway: Treat as internal exposure risk and monitor airway, swallowing, and mental status continuously. IF vomiting, chest pain, or neurologic decline appears, THEN escalate disposition promptly.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Battery acid or alkali exposure: Treat as caustic high-risk mechanism and maintain prolonged irrigation strategy. IF deepening pain or tissue injury continues, THEN escalate urgently.
severity_modifiers.Cleaning agent splash: Assume mixed-irritant exposure and complete full decontamination before reassessment conclusions. IF symptoms persist after protocol cycle, THEN escalate care tier.
severity_modifiers.Fuel/solvent contact: Treat as dermal/respiratory combined risk and monitor for delayed systemic effects. IF dizziness, nausea, or breathing changes appear, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.Unknown chemical source: Use broad decontamination and conservative high-risk monitoring until clarified. IF trajectory worsens without clear cause, THEN escalate early.
severity_modifiers.Pesticide/insecticide concentrate exposu: Treat as mixed dermal/inhalation/toxic ingestion risk and intensify systemic monitoring. IF cholinergic-like symptoms, breathing compromise, or neurologic decline appears, THEN escalate emergency pathway immediately.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Mild irritation only: Continue decontamination and objective symptom trend checks at fixed intervals. IF irritation progresses beyond local findings, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Progressive pain/burn signs: Treat as evolving tissue injury and shorten reassessment intervals now. IF progression continues despite decontamination, THEN escalate disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Shock/neurologic decline: Treat as critical systemic toxicity pattern and prioritize circulation/airway stabilization. IF instability persists, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation.

anatomy_guardrails.Systemic / Whole Body: Monitor temperature trend, perfusion markers, and urine output while cooling. IF instability persists despite cooling, THEN escalate disposition.
anatomy_guardrails.Volume/Fluid Loss Pattern: Quantify intake/output and correct dehydration early to prevent deterioration. IF rehydration response is poor, THEN escalate care level.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Dehydration / low intake: Treat as major amplifier and prioritize volume restoration early. IF perfusion trend remains poor after correction, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.Exertion in heat: Stop exertion immediately and continue cooling until trend stabilizes. IF exertional symptoms persist at rest, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.High humidity / low airflow: Assume impaired evaporative cooling and intensify active cooling measures. IF objective heat burden remains high, THEN escalate disposition.
severity_modifiers.Prolonged sun exposure: Treat as cumulative thermal load and extend monitoring window beyond initial improvement. IF rebound symptoms appear, THEN escalate quickly.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Heat exhaustion pattern: Use active cooling plus hydration and short-interval reassessment protocol. IF symptoms fail to improve quickly, THEN escalate disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Mild heat stress: Use conservative cooling/rest approach with timed objective trend checks. IF symptoms progress during monitoring, THEN reclassify and escalate.

anatomy_guardrails.Extremity Cold Injury Risk: Protect distal tissues from further cold trauma and monitor sensation/perfusion trends. IF numbness, pallor, or severe pain progresses, THEN escalate care tier.
anatomy_guardrails.Respiratory/Cardiac Instability Risk: Minimize exertion and monitor breathing/pulse rhythm at short fixed intervals. IF instability signs emerge, THEN escalate as high-acuity pathway.
anatomy_guardrails.Systemic / Core Temperature Pattern: Use gradual core-focused warming and avoid rapid aggressive peripheral-only warming. IF shivering stops with worsening mentation, THEN escalate urgently.

severity_modifiers.Immersion exposure: Assume rapid core heat loss and increase observation intensity. IF delayed respiratory or neurologic decline appears, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.Night exposure / inadequate shelter: Treat as sustained cold load and extend warming/monitoring cycle. IF recovery plateaus, THEN escalate care level.
severity_modifiers.Wet clothing + wind: Correct evaporative and convective heat loss factors immediately. IF persistent instability follows correction, THEN escalate.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Moderate confusion/slurred speech: Treat as significant core-cooling progression and shorten reassessment intervals. IF neurologic signs worsen, THEN escalate urgently.

Marine Bite / Laceration Contamination.procedure: Control bleeding first, irrigate contamination thoroughly, and monitor for infection/systemic progression. IF bleeding, neurovascular deficit, or systemic decline appears, THEN escalate immediately.

anatomy_guardrails.Face/Neck Bite Zone: Treat proximity to airway/vessels as high-risk and monitor swelling/bleeding closely. IF airway compromise or deep-vessel concern appears, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Foot/Ankle Bite Zone: Assess tendon/vascular compromise and contamination burden at fixed intervals. IF perfusion/function declines, THEN escalate disposition.
anatomy_guardrails.Hand/Finger Bite Zone: Protect function-critical structures and reassess distal neurovascular status repeatedly. IF pain/swelling/function worsens, THEN escalate care tier.
anatomy_guardrails.Arm/Shoulder Bite Zone: Assess deltoid/axillary involvement, deep tissue loss, and proximal neurovascular status immediately. IF expanding hematoma, neurologic deficit, or arterial-bleeding concern appears, THEN escalate to IMMEDIATE EVACUATION.
anatomy_guardrails.Leg/Thigh Bite Zone: Treat as high blood-loss and muscle-compartment risk site; reassess distal perfusion and motor function every cycle. IF perfusion declines, severe swelling progresses, or pain is out of proportion, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Torso/Back Bite Zone: Assume occult deep-structure injury and contamination burden even when external wound appears limited. IF respiratory compromise, abdominal pain, or shock trend appears, THEN escalate to IMMEDIATE pathway.
anatomy_guardrails.Genital/Perineal Bite Zone: Treat as high-contamination high-complication region with strict hemostasis and infection surveillance. IF uncontrolled bleeding, urinary dysfunction, or rapidly spreading swelling occurs, THEN escalate immediately.
anatomy_guardrails.Forearm/Wrist Bite Zone: Prioritize tendon, nerve, and vascular integrity checks with repeat distal neurovascular reassessment. IF function or perfusion worsens after initial stabilization, THEN escalate disposition without delay.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Fish bite: Treat as contamination-prone wound with strong infection surveillance. IF spreading redness or systemic signs appear, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.Large marine animal bite: Treat as high-force mechanism with potential occult structural injury. IF instability develops, THEN escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Saltwater contamination delay: Treat as elevated infection risk with tighter reassessment cadence. IF delayed presentation plus worsening signs occurs, THEN escalate disposition.

mechanism_modifiers.Controlled bleeding + contamination: Continue irrigation-focused management and infection surveillance. IF contamination-related progression appears, THEN escalate promptly.
mechanism_modifiers.Neurovascular deficit risk: Treat as limb/function threat with short-interval reassessment. IF deficits persist or worsen, THEN escalate urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Significant active bleeding: Treat as hemorrhage-priority condition and secure hemostasis before definitive steps. IF bleeding control fails, THEN escalate immediately.

anatomy_guardrails.Face/Neck Sting Zone: Treat as airway-adjacent high risk and monitor breathing/swallowing continuously. IF airway symptoms progress, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Systemic Reaction Pattern: Prioritize whole-body trend monitoring for anaphylaxis/toxicity markers. IF systemic progression is observed, THEN escalate disposition immediately.
anatomy_guardrails.Arm/Shoulder Sting Zone: Monitor proximal swelling trajectory and neurovascular status into the shoulder girdle every reassessment cycle. IF swelling tracks proximally or motor deficit emerges, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Leg/Thigh Sting Zone: Treat as high edema and mobility-risk region with repeated distal perfusion and pain trend checks. IF progressive swelling, weakness, or perfusion decline appears, THEN escalate immediately.
anatomy_guardrails.Torso/Back Sting Zone: Assume deeper tissue toxin effects and monitor breathing/perfusion for delayed deterioration. IF chest/abdominal symptoms or systemic decline appears, THEN escalate to emergency pathway.
anatomy_guardrails.Hand/Finger Sting Zone: Prioritize digit perfusion, sensation, and flexor/extensor function checks after each intervention. IF escalating pain with neurovascular compromise appears, THEN escalate care level promptly.
anatomy_guardrails.Foot/Ankle Sting Zone: Track swelling spread, weight-bearing tolerance, and distal perfusion on a short reassessment interval. IF swelling threatens circulation or function drops, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Jellyfish/tentacle exposure: Treat as toxin contact pattern and prevent further nematocyst activation during care. IF pain/systemic signs intensify, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.Unknown marine species: Use conservative high-risk monitoring and broaden differential for toxicity progression. IF symptoms evolve unpredictably, THEN escalate early.
severity_modifiers.Urchin spine retention: Treat as foreign-body plus envenomation pattern and monitor for delayed inflammation. IF local/systemic trend worsens, THEN escalate care level.
severity_modifiers.Stonefish spine envenomation:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: STONEFISH SPINE ENVENOMATION

1. HIGH-POTENCY VENOM ASSUMPTION: Treat as severe envenomation with rapid deterioration potential even when puncture appears small.
2. IMMEDIATE HOT-WATER ADJUNCT: Immerse affected area in controlled hot water (up to 45C/113F) for 30-90 minutes; maintain safe temperature checks to avoid thermal injury.
3. SPINE/FRAGMENT CONTROL: Assume retained spine fragments until excluded; stabilize and follow Embedded Object principles for retained material.
4. SYSTEMIC SURVEILLANCE: Reassess pain trajectory, perfusion, breathing, mentation, and rhythm concerns every 5 minutes during acute phase.
5. ANALGESIA AND SUPPORT: Use pain-control and supportive medications only if listed in ONBOARD MEDICAL INVENTORY and apply route/dose exactly per onboard label/protocol.
6. ESCALATION: IF pain remains severe despite hot-water protocol, or IF hypotension, weakness/paralysis, breathing difficulty, or altered mental status appears, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE EVACUATION.
If the spine is not easily grasped with forceps, leave it in place and prioritize heat therapy. Do not attempt surgical exploration at sea.
severity_modifiers.Stingray spine injury:
MECHANISM PROTOCOL: STINGRAY SPINE INJURY

1. BROAD SPECIES ASSUMPTION: Treat as mixed puncture-laceration trauma plus venom effect; depth and tissue disruption may exceed surface appearance.
2. HEMORRHAGE/STRUCTURE PRIORITY: Control bleeding first and assess for tendon, vessel, nerve, or body-cavity involvement by location.
3. HOT-WATER ADJUNCT: Use controlled hot-water immersion (up to 45C/113F) for 30-90 minutes for venom-associated pain relief while monitoring for burn risk.
4. RETAINED BARB RISK: Assume retained barb/fragment until excluded; do not perform blind probing; follow Embedded Object stabilization principles.
5. INFECTION CONTROL: Perform high-volume irrigation and monitor for marine wound infection progression on short reassessment intervals.
6. ESCALATION: IF uncontrolled bleeding, compartment-risk swelling, systemic deterioration, or persistent severe pain occurs, THEN escalate to URGENT or IMMEDIATE EVACUATION based on trend.

anatomy_guardrails.Bleeding/Capillary Leak Risk Pattern: Watch for mucosal bleeding, petechiae, abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, and orthostatic decline. IF bleeding or perfusion instability appears, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Neurologic Warning Pattern: Monitor confusion, severe headache, focal deficit, and seizure activity each reassessment cycle. IF neurologic signs progress, THEN trigger emergency escalation.

severity_modifiers.Recent port call in endemic area: Assume geographically relevant tropical-pathogen risk and extend observation window. IF systemic decline appears, THEN escalate promptly.
severity_modifiers.No effective bite protection used: Treat as increased inoculation risk and increase clinical vigilance. IF fever pattern worsens across cycles, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.Clustered febrile illness among crew: Treat as outbreak signal and strengthen infection-control plus serial reassessment. IF multiple crew deteriorate, THEN escalate external support request early.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Shock or altered mental status: Treat as critical tropical febrile emergency with immediate stabilization priorities. IF instability persists, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE EVACUATION pathway.

anatomy_guardrails.Respiratory/Hemorrhagic Warning Pattern: Watch for cough, breathlessness, hemoptysis-like symptoms, or mucosal bleeding trends. IF respiratory or bleeding instability appears, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE EVACUATION.

anatomy_guardrails.Eye UV Injury Pattern: Treat photophobia, tearing, and vision disturbance as ocular injury warning signs with frequent reassessment. IF vision worsens or severe pain persists, THEN escalate urgently.

severity_modifiers.Inadequate protective clothing: Treat as preventable high-dose exposure and increase vigilance for broader injury. IF widespread involvement appears, THEN escalate promptly.

severity_modifiers.Side flash/conducted strike from rigging: Treat as significant electrical transfer event and monitor for delayed cardiac/neurologic sequelae. IF symptoms evolve, THEN escalate promptly.

anatomy_guardrails.Root / Socket Involvement: Treat as deeper structural injury risk with tight follow-up cadence. IF mobility, bleeding, or severe pain persists, THEN escalate urgently.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Exposed pulp visible: Treat as high-risk pain/infection state and intensify protective protocol now. IF pain remains severe or systemic signs appear, THEN escalate disposition.
severity_modifiers.Pain controlled: Continue conservative protection with scheduled reassessment intervals. IF stability holds, THEN maintain onboard protocol.
severity_modifiers.Severe pain: Treat as unstable symptom burden and shorten reassessment interval immediately. IF severe pain persists despite treatment, THEN escalate urgency tier.
severity_modifiers.Uncontrolled bleeding: Treat as hemorrhage-first condition and secure hemostasis before definitive steps. IF bleeding remains uncontrolled, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Biting hard object: Treat as stress-fracture mechanism and monitor for crack extension. IF bite pain escalates, THEN escalate treatment urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Blunt facial impact: Assume associated soft-tissue and jaw injury risk and reassess serially. IF progression occurs, THEN escalate promptly.
mechanism_modifiers.Fall: Treat as higher-energy event with broader facial injury surveillance. IF neurologic/facial signs worsen, THEN escalate disposition urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Prior decay / weakened tooth: Treat as reduced structural reserve with lower threshold for progression. IF symptoms worsen despite conservative care, THEN escalate.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Other / Unspecified.procedure: PROBLEM UNSPECIFIED (DENTAL): Control pain and bleeding conservatively, preserve structures, avoid extraction unless airway is threatened, and reassess swelling, pain, and airway status every 30 minutes.

anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Psychological/Behavioral.mindset: Vessel safety first. Secure the environment; avoid chemical restraint.

Aggression / Violence Risk.procedure: Secure scene safety first, separate hazards, and assign continuous observation roles. IF escalation continues despite de-escalation steps, THEN prioritize crew protection and urgent evacuation planning.

anatomy_guardrails.Whole person / behavioral state: Treat as a whole-person behavioral safety condition, not a focal anatomic injury pathway. Prioritize scene safety, observation continuity, airway-breathing-circulation checks, and escalation by risk trajectory. IF physical self-harm or traumatic injury is present, THEN route definitive injury management through the Trauma pathway.
anatomy_guardrails.Other / Unspecified: ANATOMY UNSPECIFIED: Assume potential involvement of critical structures. Use the least invasive stabilization approach, avoid irreversible intervention, and reassess airway/perfusion/neurologic status every 10 minutes until location is clarified.

severity_modifiers.Cooperative but escalated: Use directive calm communication and short reassessment intervals. IF cooperation declines across checks, THEN reclassify to unsafe and escalate.
severity_modifiers.Dangerous to self/others: Treat as immediate safety emergency with continuous control measures. IF imminent harm risk persists, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Unsafe behavior: Treat as active operational risk and increase supervision immediately. IF unsafe acts continue despite redirection, THEN escalate containment tier.
severity_modifiers.Weapon/object access risk: Prioritize rapid means-restriction and crew protective positioning. IF access cannot be reliably controlled, THEN escalate disposition urgently.

mechanism_modifiers.Acute conflict / interpersonal trigger: Separate involved crew and prevent continued trigger exposure. IF conflict remains active, THEN escalate observation and command controls.
mechanism_modifiers.Heat stress / dehydration: Treat as reversible physiologic amplifier and correct hydration/temperature early. IF behavior does not improve after correction, THEN escalate medical risk tier.
mechanism_modifiers.Sleep deprivation: Treat as impaired judgment risk and reduce operational demands immediately. IF instability persists despite rest measures, THEN escalate care urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Substance use suspected: Assume prolonged impairment window and monitor airway/trauma risk continuously. IF mentation worsens or violence risk rises, THEN escalate disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Confusion / Delirium-like Behavior.procedure: Treat as potential medical emergency first, with safety controls and frequent orientation checks. IF confusion worsens or new neurologic signs appear, THEN escalate to urgent medical pathway immediately.

anatomy_guardrails.Whole person / behavioral state: Treat as a whole-person behavioral safety condition, not a focal anatomic injury pathway. Prioritize scene safety, observation continuity, airway-breathing-circulation checks, and escalation by risk trajectory. severity_modifiers.Altered mental status: Treat as high-acuity state requiring short-interval reassessment now. IF mentation declines further, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Cooperative but disoriented: Use structured prompts and monitor trend objectively each cycle. IF cooperation declines or disorientation deepens, THEN escalate tier.
severity_modifiers.Dangerous disorganization: Treat as immediate safety threat with continuous supervision. IF inability to follow safety commands persists, THEN escalate disposition urgently.
severity_modifiers.Unsafe wandering / task interference: Prioritize redirection away from operational hazards and assign watcher role. IF interference continues, THEN escalate containment and evacuation planning.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.CO/toxic exposure risk: Treat as toxic etiology until excluded and remove exposure source immediately. IF symptoms persist after removal, THEN escalate urgent medical pathway.
mechanism_modifiers.Heat illness context: Actively cool and hydrate while tracking neurologic trend closely. IF confusion persists despite correction, THEN escalate disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Recent head impact: Assume post-traumatic neurologic risk and increase monitoring intensity. IF headache, vomiting, or decline worsens, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Sleep deprivation: Treat as contributing factor but do not anchor; reassess for medical causes each cycle. IF no improvement with rest support, THEN escalate medical urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Hallucination / Psychosis-like Behavior.procedure: Maintain safety distance, one-lead communication, and low-stimulation environment while monitoring medical red flags. IF command-following deteriorates or threat behavior emerges, THEN escalate to emergency safety pathway.

severity_modifiers.Command-following intact: Use structured verbal containment and rapid reassessment intervals. IF command-following degrades, THEN escalate to unsafe tier.
severity_modifiers.Dangerous behavior: Treat as immediate safety emergency and protect crew/patient from harm now. IF danger remains active, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.
severity_modifiers.Persecutory/fear-driven agitation: Use calm directive de-escalation with strict environmental control. IF agitation escalates or paranoia worsens, THEN escalate safety tier.
severity_modifiers.Unsafe reality detachment: Treat as high-risk judgment failure and increase observation continuously. IF patient attempts hazardous actions, THEN escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Acute sleep deprivation: Treat as major destabilizer and initiate protected rest protocol when safe. IF psychotic-like symptoms persist, THEN escalate medical urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Substance intoxication/withdrawal: Assume fluctuating course and monitor airway, trauma, and behavior risk continuously. IF instability increases, THEN escalate disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Toxic exposure risk: Treat as potential toxic encephalopathy and remove exposure source now. IF symptoms persist after removal, THEN escalate urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Unknown trigger: Use broad safety-first approach with short reassessment cycles. IF trajectory worsens without clear cause, THEN escalate early.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Panic / Acute Anxiety Episode.procedure: Stabilize breathing pattern, reduce stimulation, and reassess objective vitals at fixed intervals. IF symptoms fail to improve or medical red flags appear, THEN escalate beyond anxiety framing immediately.

severity_modifiers.Breathing distress symptoms: Treat as high-acuity respiratory overlap until objective stabilization is clear. IF distress progresses or oxygenation declines, THEN escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Calming with coaching: Continue structured coaching and trend objective improvement markers. IF relapse occurs rapidly, THEN increase monitoring intensity.
severity_modifiers.Persistent severe panic: Treat as unresolved instability with shortened reassessment intervals. IF severe symptoms persist despite coaching, THEN escalate disposition tier.
severity_modifiers.Unsafe panic-driven behavior: Prioritize injury prevention and controlled containment immediately. IF unsafe actions continue, THEN escalate urgently.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Acute stress event: Remove active stressor and apply structured grounding protocol. IF dysregulation persists, THEN escalate care level.
mechanism_modifiers.Caffeine/stimulant excess: Treat as physiologic amplifier and monitor cardiovascular response closely. IF tachycardia/chest symptoms persist, THEN escalate evaluation urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Heat stress / dehydration: Correct thermal and volume contributors while monitoring symptom trajectory. IF symptoms fail to improve after correction, THEN escalate medically.
mechanism_modifiers.Sleep deprivation: Treat as threshold-lowering factor and reduce operational load immediately. IF instability continues, THEN escalate support and disposition.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Sleep Deprivation Functional Decline.procedure: Reduce operational workload, enforce protected rest windows, and monitor cognition/safety trend in timed cycles. IF function continues to decline or unsafe behavior emerges, THEN escalate to urgent safety-medical pathway.

severity_modifiers.Confusion / poor judgment: Treat as active safety risk and shorten reassessment intervals. IF judgment deficits persist, THEN escalate disposition tier.
severity_modifiers.Cooperative fatigue: Use structured rest-recovery plan with scheduled cognition checks. IF fatigue trend worsens, THEN escalate restrictions and monitoring.
severity_modifiers.Near-miss safety incidents: Treat as high-risk operational signal requiring immediate duty modification. IF incidents continue, THEN escalate urgent evacuation planning.
severity_modifiers.Unsafe operational behavior: Prioritize vessel and crew safety with immediate activity restrictions. IF unsafe behavior persists despite restrictions, THEN escalate urgently.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.High watch rotation burden: Treat as cumulative fatigue mechanism and rebalance watches immediately. IF no functional recovery appears, THEN escalate.
mechanism_modifiers.Illness/pain-related sleep loss: Address upstream medical driver while preserving rest opportunity. IF combined decline continues, THEN escalate medical pathway.
mechanism_modifiers.Psychological stress: Use structured decompression and communication controls. IF stress-linked decline worsens, THEN escalate support level.
mechanism_modifiers.Substance/caffeine disruption: Remove contributing agents and monitor recovery trend objectively. IF impairment persists, THEN escalate evaluation urgency.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Suicidal / Self-Harm Concern.procedure: Treat as immediate safety emergency with constant observation and lethal-means restriction. IF active intent, plan, or attempt behavior is present, THEN escalate to IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway without delay.

severity_modifiers.Active attempt behavior: Treat as critical life-threatening emergency now. IF attempts continue or recur, THEN maintain continuous containment and trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation.
severity_modifiers.Explicit plan and intent: Treat as high-imminence risk requiring constant observation and means restriction. IF intent escalates or concealment behavior appears, THEN escalate immediately.
severity_modifiers.Passive ideation without plan: Treat as serious risk with structured safety planning and continuous trend monitoring. IF ideation intensity increases or plan emerges, THEN reclassify and escalate urgently.
severity_modifiers.Unable/unwilling safety commitment: Treat as unstable high-risk state regardless of verbal reassurance. IF supervision gaps are possible, THEN escalate disposition immediately.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Isolation / prolonged offshore stress: Treat as sustained risk amplifier and increase support/contact cadence. IF hopelessness or withdrawal worsens, THEN escalate urgency tier.
mechanism_modifiers.Recent major stressor/loss: Treat as acute destabilizer and tighten observation intervals. IF ideation intensifies after trigger reminders, THEN escalate promptly.
mechanism_modifiers.Sleep deprivation: Treat as judgment-impairing cofactor and reduce demands immediately. IF risk remains high after rest support, THEN escalate further.
mechanism_modifiers.Substance use: Assume disinhibition and volatility risk; maintain continuous supervision. IF intoxication/withdrawal signs worsen, THEN escalate immediately.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.

Suicidal Ideation.procedure: Treat as immediate safety emergency with constant observation, means restriction, and timed reassessment. IF intent/plan escalates or containment fails, THEN trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation pathway.

severity_modifiers.Active plan and means: COMMANDER/CAPTAIN maintain continuous containment and trigger IMMEDIATE evacuation.
severity_modifiers.Explicit plan and intent: High-imminence risk. Constant observation. Remove all means (sharps, ligatures, medications).
severity_modifiers.Passive ideation: Treat as serious baseline risk even without explicit plan. Implement structured safety planning, remove access to common means, and maintain direct check-ins every 60 minutes. IF ideation intensity increases, protective factors weaken, or a plan emerges, THEN reclassify to high-imminence risk and escalate disposition immediately.
severity_modifiers.Unable to commit to safety: Treat as unstable. Continuous supervision required. Escalate disposition immediately.
severity_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: MECHANISM/Cause UNSPECIFIED: Assume contamination plus hidden-injury risk. Do not perform irreversible procedures until mechanism risk is better defined. Repeat focused reassessment every 10 minutes.

mechanism_modifiers.Recent major stressor/loss: Treat as acute destabilizer and shorten reassessment intervals with active trigger management. IF ideation intensity increases after reminders, THEN escalate disposition urgently.
mechanism_modifiers.Sleep deprivation: Treat as judgment-impairing cofactor and reduce cognitive/operational load immediately. IF risk remains elevated after rest support, THEN escalate further.
mechanism_modifiers.Substance use: Assume disinhibition and volatility risk; maintain continuous supervision and means restriction. IF intoxication/withdrawal instability worsens, THEN escalate without delay.
mechanism_modifiers.Other / Unspecified: SEVERITY/Complication UNSPECIFIED: Treat as at least concerning. Increase monitoring frequency and use a low threshold for urgent escalation or evacuation if the patient worsens.
